svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - November 9 2018
title: "November 9, 2018" date: "2018-11-09"
News and Links
Layer 1
• [Eth 2.0] Lighthouse fortnight client update - devcon, libp2p in Rust, basic block processing
[Eth 2.0] Lighthouse fortnight client update - devcon, libp2p in Rust, basic block processing
• [Eth 2.0] Client validator architecture notes
[Eth 2.0] Client validator architecture notes
• [Eth 2.0] Network-adjusted timestamps
[Eth 2.0] Network-adjusted timestamps
• [Eth 2.0] The economic incentives of staking discussion
[Eth 2.0] The economic incentives of staking discussion
• [Casper CBC] Aditya Asgaonkar’s Casper CBC explainer
[Casper CBC] Aditya Asgaonkar’s Casper CBC explainer
Layer 2
• Part 2 of POA Network’s how Honey Badger BFT works
Part 2 of POA Network’s how Honey Badger BFT works
• Raiden monthly updates . also, v0.16 release
Raiden monthly updates . also, v0.16 release
Stuff for developers
• MetaMask’s privacy mode (EIP1102). Right now, it’s opt-in for users, but devs should update. Their
mobile app is aiming for q1 2019
MetaMask’s privacy mode (EIP1102). Right now, it’s opt-in for users, but devs should update. Their
• Leo Alt: built-in formal verification in Solidity in the SMTChecker and how it works
Leo Alt: built-in formal verification in Solidity in the SMTChecker and how it works
• A quick dive into Trail of Bits’ Slither , their Solidity static analyzer
A quick dive into Trail of Bits’ Slither , their Solidity static analyzer
• solpp - Solidity preprocessor and flattener
solpp - Solidity preprocessor and flattener
• Tutorial on a private layer 2 voting system with Enigma
Tutorial on a private layer 2 voting system with Enigma
• Zeppelin’s Solidity compiler audit
Zeppelin’s Solidity compiler audit
• Pipeline visual IDE now available as a Remix plugin
Pipeline visual IDE now available as a Remix plugin
• Atomic batched transactions - multiple ERC20 transfers at once through MetaTX
Atomic batched transactions - multiple ERC20 transfers at once through MetaTX
• Parity’s Fether - alpha release of a wallet with a light client, so you can embed light clients in
your dapps. (Not audited, defaults to Kovan, don’t use on mainnet yet)
Parity’s Fether - alpha release of a wallet with a light client, so you can embed light clients in
• meeseeks.app - a static file hosted on a CDN to allow websites easier IPFS hosting with
human-readable ENS names.
meeseeks.app - a static file hosted on a CDN to allow websites easier IPFS hosting with human-readable
ENS names.
Ecosystem
• Burner Wallet runs on POA’s xDAI and exchanges value between phones without app download
Burner Wallet runs on POA’s xDAI and exchanges value between phones without app download
• ConsenSys Grants - $500k given through Gitcoin in amounts of 10k-25k
ConsenSys Grants - $500k given through Gitcoin in amounts of 10k-25k
• Status’ Cryptolife hackathon winners
Status’ Cryptolife hackathon winners
• MyCrypto’s Taylor Monahan: the unintended consequences of product design
MyCrypto’s Taylor Monahan: the unintended consequences of product design
Enterprise
• AWS and Kaleido announce plug and play marketplace for enterprise
AWS and Kaleido announce plug and play marketplace for enterprise
• BBVA, MUFG and BNP Paribas do $150m syndicate loan for Red Electronica on a private chain but
timestamped to the mainchain
BBVA, MUFG and BNP Paribas do $150m syndicate loan for Red Electronica on a private chain but
Governance and Standards
• Core devs call . Constantinople hard fork scheduled for Jan 16.
Core devs call . Constantinople hard fork scheduled for Jan 16.
• Whitelisting holders and traders of security tokens with ERC-1404
Whitelisting holders and traders of security tokens with ERC-1404
• Security token standards creating automatic compliance
Security token standards creating automatic compliance
• Péter Szilágyi proposes Ethereum Engineering Efforts - document (and improve) the necessary
cross-team processes
Péter Szilágyi proposes Ethereum Engineering Efforts - document (and improve) the necessary cross-team
processes
• EIP1559 : fee market change for short-term volatility in block size instead of transaction fees
EIP1559 : fee market change for short-term volatility in block size instead of transaction fees
Project Updates
• Maker: Getting to fully collateralized Dai on mainnet . Also interesting data analysis of Maker over
the last month
Maker: Getting to fully collateralized Dai on mainnet . Also interesting data analysis of Maker over
• Augur 2.0 will cost 25-40% less gas and in the future may run in the browswer without the need for
an app. In the meantime, v1.7.1 is out
Augur 2.0 will cost 25-40% less gas and in the future may run in the browswer without the need for an
app. In the meantime, v1.7.1 is out
• Gitcoin has integrated ERC1337 subscriptions to allow devs stable periodic income for OSS work
Gitcoin has integrated ERC1337 subscriptions to allow devs stable periodic income for OSS work
• How TruSet thinks about capital markets reference data
How TruSet thinks about capital markets reference data
• Chainlink acquires Town Crier to use enclaves for oracles.
Chainlink acquires Town Crier to use enclaves for oracles.
• SingularDTV lines up Narcosstar Pedro Pascal’s Prospect film for streaming platform in 2019
SingularDTV lines up Narcosstar Pedro Pascal’s Prospect film for streaming platform in 2019
• IBM announces its Data Shield Experimental with iExec (SGX)
IBM announces its Data Shield Experimental with iExec (SGX)
Interviews, Podcasts, Videos, Talks
• Zooko talks Sapling and more on Zero Knowledge
Zooko talks Sapling and more on Zero Knowledge
• Video of Future of layer 2 meetup at Devcon
Video of Future of layer 2 meetup at Devcon
• Joe Lubin keynote at WebSummit
Joe Lubin keynote at WebSummit
• A print Q&A with ConsenSys’ Sam Cassatt and Joe Lubin
A print Q&A with ConsenSys’ Sam Cassatt and Joe Lubin
• Brendan Eich on What Bitcoin Did
Brendan Eich on What Bitcoin Did
• Maker’s Steven Becker on BoostVC podcast
Maker’s Steven Becker on BoostVC podcast
Tokens / Business / Regulation
• The court docs settling SEC’s case against EtherDelta founder Zack Coburn. He paid almost $400k,
which is substantial but a fraction of his earnings and he admitted no guilt. The SEC got to claim
that ED traded securities, without having to litigate it and risk losing jurisdiction. Not clear what
facts the SEC considers to be dealbreakers and what is mere dicta.
The court docs settling SEC’s case against EtherDelta founder Zack Coburn. He paid almost $400k, which
is substantial but a fraction of his earnings and he admitted no guilt. The SEC got to claim that ED
traded securities, without having to litigate it and risk losing jurisdiction. Not clear what facts
the SEC considers to be dealbreakers and what is mere dicta.
• Kyle Samani highlights Livepeer’s MerkleMine as an example of good token distribution
Kyle Samani highlights Livepeer’s MerkleMine as an example of good token distribution
• Why crypto networks will eat the SaaS industry . Recommended alone for the first graphic!
Why crypto networks will eat the SaaS industry . Recommended alone for the first graphic!
• Tyler Cowen: the price crash could be good for web3
Tyler Cowen: the price crash could be good for web3
General
• “the most interesting stuff that’s going on is the beginning of execution on top of blockchain, the
most obvious example being the capability of Ethereum.” - Google’s Eric Schmidt with Tyler Cowen
“the most interesting stuff that’s going on is the beginning of execution on top of blockchain, the
• Alex Tapscott in NYT op-ed: “ It’s Time for Online Voting” . Maybe someday, but that day seems quite
a way off.
Alex Tapscott in NYT op-ed: “ It’s Time for Online Voting” . Maybe someday, but that day seems quite a
way off.
• Tim Swanson: Systematically important cryptocurrency networks
Tim Swanson: Systematically important cryptocurrency networks
• Best thing on Twitter this week was William Shatner explaining Eth standards and governance
Best thing on Twitter this week was William Shatner explaining Eth standards and governance
Dates of Note
Upcoming dates of note (new additions in bold):
• Dec 7-9 - ETHSingapore hackathon (ETHGlobal)
Dec 7-9 - ETHSingapore hackathon (ETHGlobal)
• Jan 10 - Mobi Grand Challenge hackathon ends
Jan 10 - Mobi Grand Challenge hackathon ends
• Jan 29-30 - AraCon (Berlin)
Jan 29-30 - AraCon (Berlin)
• Feb 7-8 - Melonport’s M1 conf (Zug)
Feb 7-8 - Melonport’s M1 conf (Zug)
• Feb 15-17 - ETHDenver hackathon (ETHGlobal)
Feb 15-17 - ETHDenver hackathon (ETHGlobal)
• Feb 23-25 - EthAustin hackathon (EthUniversal)
Feb 23-25 - EthAustin hackathon (EthUniversal)
If you appreciate this newsletter, thank ConsenSys
This newsletter is made possible by ConsenSys , which is perpetually hiring if you’re interested.
I own Week In Ethereum. As such, editorial control has always been 100% me. If you’re unhappy with
editorial decisions or anything written in this issue, feel free to tweet at me.
Housekeeping and begging
I set a goal to grow the subscriber base of this newsletter to 10000 by the end of the year, so I’d
appreciate all social network sharing.
Note : The post-Devcon issue came out a bit late. Hence the short issue this week.
This week I also published “ why didn’t my post make it into Week in Ethereum ” if you’re wondering
how I think about newsletter curation.
Most of what I link to I tweet first: @evan_van_ness
